title: NP/PA - Virtual Urgent Care - 1099
content:
Hi, we're Oscar. We’re hiring Nurse Practitioners or Physician Assistants to join our Virtual Urgent Care team. 
Oscar is the first health insurance company built around a full stack technology platform and a relentless focus on serving our members. We started Oscar in 2012 to create the kind of health insurance company we would want for ourselves—one that behaves like a doctor in the family.
This is a 1099 independent contractor role. You must be licensed in both Texas and Georgia.
About the role:
We are looking for virtual care providers who are adept at providing telemedicine services and are always looking to explore new ways we can provide virtual care. You will be delivering patient care on Oscar’s platform(s) both via messaging and phone. As an Oscar Medical Group provider, you’ll have the opportunity to re-imagine how we diagnose, treat and follow up with members virtually. You will work remotely, and work hand in hand with our team to provide exceptional patient care. We’re building this program from the ground up, so you’ll be engaging with new products and tooling that we’re rolling out for the virtual care service lines. You’ll be expected to be flexible with these tools, but know that we’re building towards something transformative – you’re part of that growth! 
Primary Duties and Responsibilities:


Provide top notch medical care virtually (both by phone and message)


Provide patient care in alignment with Oscar Medical Group guidelines, practices and policies


Focus on efficiency and quality of care delivery 


Ensure patient access to VUC services 


Collaborate with MAs, RNs, and other providers across service lines (e.g. primary care and health assessments)


Required Education & Experience: 


DNP, FNP or ENP from an accredited nursing school with Nursing board certification 


Qualified Physician Assistants will also be considered from accredited program 


Licensed in both TX AND GA (CA and FL also a huge plus, but only in addition to TX and GA)


3+ years experience in urgent care, ER or outpatient family medicine practice. 


Preferred Education and Experience:


2+ years of Telemedicine experience

Spanish language fluency (read, write, and speak - an assessment will be given prior to offer)

Licensed in other OMG states: AZ, CT, IA, IL, KS, MI, MO, NC, NJ, NY, OH, OK, PA, TN, VA


Weekend and/ or evening availability 6-9 pm PT 

This is an authentic Oscar Health job opportunity. Learn more about how you can safeguard yourself from recruitment fraud here. 
At Oscar, being an Equal Opportunity Employer means more than upholding discrimination-free hiring practices. It means that we cultivate an environment where people can be their most authentic selves and find both belonging and support. We're on a mission to change health care -- an experience made whole by our unique backgrounds and perspectives..
Pay Transparency: 
Final offer amounts, within the base pay set forth above, are determined by factors including your relevant skills, education, and experience.
Full-time employees are eligible for benefits including: medical, dental, and vision benefits, 11 paid holidays, paid sick time, paid parental leave, 401(k) plan participation, life and disability insurance, and paid wellness time and reimbursements.
Reasonable Accommodation:
Oscar applicants are considered solely based on their qualifications, without regard to applicant’s disability or need for accommodation. Any Oscar applicant who requires reasonable accommodations during the application process should contact the Oscar Benefits Team (accommodations@hioscar.com) to make the need for an accommodation known.

compliance.description: <p>PUBLIC BURDEN STATEMENT: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless such collection displays a valid OMB control number. This survey should take about 5 minutes to complete.</p>

questions.description:
The work location expectations for this role is listed in the job postings under “Work Location”. This section includes any onsite related expectations and residency requirements.

Oscar Health is authorized to do business in many, but not all, states. If you are not located in or willing to relocate to a state where Oscar is registered, you will not be eligible for employment. The approved states for this role are listed in the job posting.
